column4: I use gfxboot as suse in my ubuntu7.04, but it aways shows: graphics file "(hd0,1)/boot/grub/message.ubublown" missing, when i'm bootting. To tell you firstly, the message.ubublown file is really in the grub folder anyone here can help me out.
of couse, I'd tell you that my /boot mount to sda2 and my gfxmenu entry is like: gfxboot (hd0,1)/boot/grub/message.ubublown. Thanks!

has anyone seen my question?
i'll hook.
thanks
boot from cdrom into single user mode, mount /boot as read write... and move message.ubublown to grub
if the machine isnt working... i think thats probably your only choice.
do you know how to get into single user mode?
I init 1 and cp that message to /boo/grub/, but still the missing
but still the missing?
is english your 1st language?
what is the exact error message?
you need to reinstall something
you need to download it here http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=1252317&postcount=63 and put it in the boot directory.
what does your /boot/grub/menu.list look like... do you have "gfxmenu /boot/grub/message.ububrown" in it?
i have this grxmenu
you need to either comment it out
you need to download it here http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=1252317&postcount=63 and put it in the boot directory.
